channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Traffic congestion hits a record high, spreading to more hours of the week
item.description: If it seems like traffic is getting worse where you live, that's because it probably is. After dropping during the COVID-19 pandemic, congestion climb...

item.title: The World Cup draw is here. Here's why it matters — and how it will work
item.description: FIFA is about to determine which teams all 48 participating countries in the FIFA World Cup 2026 will face in the group phase of the tournament, which...

item.title: Who sued Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth this week? Find out in the quiz

item.title: NPR battles Trump executive order in court
item.description: NPR was in court for a pivotal hearing arguing that the Trump administration had broken the law with its treatment of public media.

item.title: China in diplomatic push to isolate Japan in feud over Taiwan issue
item.description: No end in sight to spat between Japan and China over Taiwan, as neither Tokyo nor Beijing shows signs of backing down.

item.title: All the biggest news from AWS’ big tech show re:Invent 2025
item.description: Amazon Web Services' giant tech conference re:Invent 2025 is happening this week with news ranging from chips to AI services.

item.title: Chicago Tribune sues Perplexity
item.description: The newspaper is alleging copyright infringement and calling out Perplexity's retrieval augmented generation (RAG) as a culprit.

item.title: Walmart-backed PhonePe winds down its Pincode app in yet another e-commerce step back
item.description: PhonePe has shut down its Pincode app over two years after its debut.

item.title: Shops empty in a Hispanic neighborhood as immigration crackdown comes to Louisiana
item.description: Federal border agents have descended on a Hispanic enclave just outside New Orleans and local business owners are suffering.

item.title: Immigration crackdown in New Orleans has a target of 5,000 arrests. Is that possible?
Feds ask Waymo about robotaxis repeatedly passing school buses in Austin

item.title: Micro1, a Scale AI competitor, touts crossing $100M ARR
item.description: Micro1 started the year with roughly $7 million ARR. Now, it claims to have surpassed $100 million in ARR, double what it reported in September.
